instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message: This is a refurbished board client purchased on amazon or something he cannot get a refund... boots up but keyboard trackpad not responding... im not getting 18v on trackpad connector while on so i replaced <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and still nochange that area looks like it was water damaged at somepoint...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message: 18V is only present when TP is connected. Will it do a PRAM reset? Is 3V present at power pins of <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message: I cannot perform a pram reset.... 3.3v present at the chip <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> pin 22.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message: Is 3.3V also present on J5800 pin 22?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message: Check if <SIGNAL>Z2_BOOST_EN</SIGNAL> is high at <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> while trackpad is connected. If high it should be boosting and could be broken <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> or bad circuitry around here. Inspect for broken traces and damaged components in booster circuitry. Check if 18V comes on at any point at the 18V5S4 rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message: Also check all pins from TP connector to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> for continuity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message:
Ok so <RESISTOR>R5813</RESISTOR> pin 1 1.3-4 Voltages pin 2 0.v and has a 0.000 reading on diode mode which means short to ground ?

<RESISTOR>R5812</RESISTOR> pin 1 18.4 volts pin 2 1.3-4

<CAPACITOR>C5818</CAPACITOR> pin 2 1.3v Pin 1 18.4

Duke how to check continuity on those pins.. sry for the noob question.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message:
So 18V is present, why are you wanting to do anything to this?

Boot up the board and check in the system profile if the keyboard/trackpad is recognized as a USB device.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Keyboard or Trackpad
threads.message: Then there is an issue with <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>. Check power or pin 22 and 49 <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> and check USB data lines <RESISTOR>R5701</RESISTOR>/02.
